item.title: [EN] Network Time Protocol (NTP)
item.description: In modern networks, accurate time synchronization is crucial for tasks such as logging, authentication, and system coordination. Network Time Protocol (NTP) is a widely used protocol that allows devices on a network to synchronize their clocks with a reliable time source. This guide will walk you through the configuration of NTP on Cisco devices, including manual time setup, using a device as an NTP server, authentication, and debugging. UDP Port: 123 The closest router to the Atomic Clock is called Stratum 1 A device directly connected to an authorized NTP server is considered Stratum 1.
